author: Special Correspondent
text:
To clear the extra rush of traffic during the festival season, the Southern Railway on Saturday announced special trains from Chennai Central, Chennai Egmore, Coimbatore, Puducherry and Ernakulam to various towns.

A Suvidha superfast special train from Chennai Central would leave for Ernakulam Junction at 10.30 pm on January 22 and reach its destination at 11.55 am the next day. It would stop at Katpadi, Erode, Coimbatore, Palghat and Thrissur, an official statement from the Southern Railway stated. While another superfast special train from Ernakulam Junction would leave for Chennai Central at 7 pm on January 24 and reach Chennai Central at 7.15 a.m., the next day via Aluva, Thrissur, Palghat, Coimbatore, Tiruppur, Erode, Salem, Jolarpettai, Katpadi, Arakkonam and Perambur.

A special train would be operated between Puducherry and Coimbatore Junction. It would leave Puducherry at 12.30 p.m. on January 16 and reach Coimbatore at 9 p.m., the same day. A special train would leave Coimbatore Junction for Chennai Egmore at 5.30 a.m. on January 17 and reach its destination at 4.15 p.m., the same day.

Another special train will be operated on January 16 between Kochuveli and Mangalore Junction.

It would leave Kochuveli at 10 p.m. on January 16 and reach Mangalore Junction at 11.45 a.m., the next day. Reservation for all these special trains would commence on January 10.
title: Special trains for Pongal
